author: Special Correspondent
text:
A Delhi court on Wednesday reserved orders on an application by BJP leader Subramanian Swamy, seeking summoning of documents related to the financial details of the Congress, the Associated Journals Pvt. Ltd. (AJL) and the Young Indian Pvt. Ltd. (YIL) in the National Herald case.

Congress president Sonia Gandhi, vice-president Rahul Gandhi and four others are facing prosecution in the case on a complaint by Dr. Swamy. All the accused persons in the case are on bail.

Before reserving the order, Metropolitan Magistrate Lovleen heard argument by Dr. Swamy on his plea that these documents were required for investigation into his allegations.

Allegation of fraud

Dr. Swamy sought summoning of the balance sheet, receipts, income and expenditure statements for the assessment years 2010-11, 2011-12 and 2012-13 of the party, the AJL and the YIL.

The other accused in the case are Congress general secretary Oscar Fernandes, party’s treasurer Motilal Vora and the Gandhi family loyalists Suman Dubey and Sam Pitorda.

Dr. Swamy in his complaint alleged that the accused persons had fraudulently acquired AJL, publisher of the now defunct daily, National Herald , and transferred its assets worth crores of rupees to the YIL.
title: Court reserves orders on Swamy’s plea in National Herald case
